captions.text:
Welcome to How To Cook That
I am Ann Reardon and we've got an exciting

episode for you this week.
A couple of weeks ago I asked you to nominate

all your favourite youtube channels. I've
tallied up the results and will make the top

ten for you today. If a channel you requested
is here make sure you head on over to their

channel and let them know that How To Cook
That made them a cupcake.

First things first I made a batch of my perfect
sponge cake recipe into the cupcakes and topped

each one with a mixture of vanilla buttercream
and white chocolate ganache. All of those

recipes and their videos are on this weeks
blog post howtocookthat.net, I'll put a link
in the description just below this video.

Starting at number 10. We have RR cherry pie
she has a mixture of videos all about different

cute and miniature things. To make her logo
roll out some white and yellow fondant cut

out a small circle from the yellow and take
the circle bit out leaving the larger bit

in place. Then take your white fondant over
the top and flip it over. Then use a circle

cutter that is one size bigger than what we
just used and cut it out. So that gives us

a yellow border all the way around our white
circle. I am using soft sugar pearls and I

bought at the supermarket and I'm just pressing
them around the edge. Then mix together some

icing sugar red colour and a tiny bit of water
and use that to pipe on the RR for RR cherry
pie.

At number 9 is Surprise Kids - you asked for
it - Surprise Kids is my boys channel. They

don't really have a logo yet but their thumbnail
is a picture of one of them holding a fin

cookie that they made so we'll use that. Cut
out rectangles of white fondant and round

out the corners then roll an oval ball of
pale skin coloured fondant and squash it into

place. Roll out some blue fondant and place
it over the bottom half and then trim it to

the size of the white. Then using some store
bought piping gel add two eyes and a mouth.

Number 8 is Superwoman
"What up everybody it's your girl superwoman"

Lilly has a comedy channel, but a disclaimer
here some of her videos have adult themes

and are not suitable for a younger audience
if you are older then she has a super funny

channel you can check it out. She recently
came to Australia for youtube fanfest and

she did a great job on stage.
To make a superwoman logo print it out and

then cut it out, do not throw out any of those
little pieces because we are going to need

them.
Roll out some white fondant and rub it with

a tiny bit of oil. And then place your paper
with the logo sized hole over the top. Then

add the superwoman logo bit and then and put
those tiny yellow pieces back into place.

Peel off the red that was just there to guide
us where to put the yellow ones. Then take

some pink edible luster dust and a dry paint
brush and dust it on over the top. Then brush

all the excess all over to one side, you can
reuse that, and carefully remove the paper.

Put your circle cutter over the top and cut
it out.

Coming in at number 7 We have an Australian
you tuber My Cupcake Addiction she has just

had her second baby so make sure you head
over to her channel and say congratulations

and let her know How To Cook That made her
cupcake.

To make her logo cut out a circle of white
and then a smaller circle of pink. Use your

first larger cutter size to trim off the top
of the pink circle. And then cut out a smaller

white circle and add it to your base then
add the pink bit on top of that. Using some

melted chocolate outline the shapes and then
add those curved stripes going towards the

centre at the bottom. Take a tiny bit of red
and roll it onto a ball and add it on top
like a cherry.

Number 6 most requested channel graveyard
girl "hey everybody it's bunny and welcome"

I like this channel too, Bunny does a great
job, it is sort of a beauty channel but totally

unique. She has swamp family tea cups so that
is what we are going to make here. Roll a

snake of fondant and cut it off at the top
and the bottom. Then run the knife around

the top edge to make an indent like a lid.
Then roll a tiny snake for a straw.

Take toothpick and make a hole in the top,
but don't add your straw right away leave

it for about and hour so it will dry out.
Once it's dried out then you can add a tiny

brush of water and put the straw in the top
of your swamp teacup.

Lets break from our top ten count here to
add in a little channel - you suggested loads

of small channels and they each had only one
suggestion so it took a while to choose which

one to do. This one is called This Charming
Stuff and she makes cute charms out of polymer

clay. You can follow her tutorials and just
swap fondant instead of polymer clay and use

it on cakes. Her logo is a cupcake to make
it just roll out some brown fondant into a

ball then roll it to make it narrower at one
end. Squash it down flatter until you get

a cupcake case shape. Using a knife make indents
all the way around the case. Take your green

fondant and roll a long snake, starting at
the centre swirl it around and around until

you get to the top then twist it off to give
a nice piped look.

5 bethany mota
Bethany is just 18 years old and has a huge

beauty youtube channel on youtube and even
her own clothing line at aeropostale.

Until this week she has had this cute background
with a little photo and a cut camera but she's

just changed it. So too late now because I've
already made her a cupcake. Never mind, Lets

make the cute camera, just roll out some black
fondant use a straw to cut the circle and

place it over the brown. Use a black gel colour
to outline it and then cut out the camera

shape. For the photo I lust cut a rectangle
of white and put a faun rectangle on top.

Then rolled out a teardrop of pink and split
it at the top to make a heart and place that
onto the photo.

At number 4 we have the Shaytards
"We are a family of 6 and we have been making

daily videos for the last 4 years." To make
the profile of shays face print it out and

use a knife to indent key points onto the
fondant and then use black gel colour to paint
it on.

Shay carl started vlogging to document his
last year of being twenty, now 5 years on

he has millions of subscribers his wife and
kids all have their own channels, he was a

cofounder of maker studios a youtube network
that recently sold to Disney.

Number 3 is Zoella another beauty channel
"hello everybody today I am doing another

hairstyle for you" and she has clothing halls,
hair tutorials and makeup tutorials all of

those things. Take some pink, white and green
fondant and roughly twist it together and

then roll it out. Use your circle cutter to
take a nice coloured piece out. And then take

a printout of her logo put it over the top
and make an indent using a knife so you know

where to pipe. Then take some melted chocolate
pipe the word Zoella onto the fondant.

At number 2 most requested by you was Nerdy
Nummies a channel by Rosanna Pansino welcome

to another nerdy nummies" where she makes
nerdy baked goods each week. To make her logo

cut out a circle of cookie coloured fondant
and then use melted chocolate to pipe on some

chocolate chips. Take some black fondant and
roll it super thin place it across the cookie,

trim it to length and then take some more
fondant and make the glasses shape. Ro was

lucky enough to be one of the channels recently
promoted in a youtube ad campaign all over

New York and the subways and everywhere.
Take two balls of the black and roll them

into the circles for the eyeballs and squash
them into place and then take an even smaller

snake of black and put it in place for the
mouth. Then roll two balls of pink and squash
them in place for those rosy cheeks.

OK lets pause the count again... you were
watching my channel so of course heaps and

heaps of you said you wanted How To Cook That
in it, so I am not going to count it in the

top ten but will show you how to make it.
Roll out some fondant then place the texture

mat over the top and push down using the roller.
Then just peel it off and you're left with

the pattern indented into the fondant.
Now for detailed logos you can get them printed

onto icing sheets like this. You can buy a
printer that's special with edible ink and

you can buy the special icing paper or you
can send your picture to a place online that

will print it for you which is a much cheaper
option. Cut it out and rub gently on the back

of it to loosen the backing paper off it.
Dampen the fondant and add the logo on top.
Then use a circle cutter to cut around it.

And now drumroll the number 1 most requested
was of course Pewdiepie "They actually like

me, yeah brofist"
To make the bro fist print the logo and cut

around it in black fondant. Roll a snake of
blue and use that to make the thumb shape

and then the kind of m shape as well.
Interestingly he is not the most subscribed

youtube channel though, youtube itself has
5 channels and they all collate top videos

in different categories. But he's the number
1 youtuber.

I have to add a disclaimer here too because
his videos contain language and some gaming

content that is not suitable for children.
Add it to the black then use your knife to

squash it into place. Place the black onto
the white and cut it out. Roll a circle of
blue and place the bro-fist on top.

Add your cupcake toppers onto your cupcakes
and then you can serve them on a cupcake stand.

When you check out the channels make sure
you let them know that How To Cook That made

them a cupcake and if you haven't already
hit that subscribe button, do so, there is

a new cake, chocolate or dessert video every
week. Add all your requests below check out

the channel here, last weeks jelly bean recipe
video is here and my website is here.

Have an awesome week and I'll see you on Friday.
[music by youtube.com.setsailtv used with
permission]

title: YouTube Cupcakes HOW TO COOK THAT Ann Reardon
